website_summaries.verdict: A professional-quality 3D pen with plenty of features to suit all types of users, including young ones.
pros: The MYNT3D pen's speed can be changed at the touch of a button and users can also precisely adjust the temperature at which the pen heats up
A display on the side of the pen gives you a quick view of the chosen settings
The pen comes with starter filament and is backed by a 1-year limited warranty
cons: Slow to heat up and power cord is a bit short

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I used this pen to mend 3D prints and sometimes to weld 3D printed parts together. It came in real handy on this 7/8ths scale coach, which (except for the platform and the connectors) is entirely printed. I tried several others, but this one worked best because, it does not clog, the stream of material is easy to control, and it feels good in my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Coconut

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer warns it may not work
customer_reviews.text: The display, feeder button, heating mechanism, temperature settings, back-up button, and motor are all operational, but the pen doesn't extrude the ABS plastic included. No matter which troubleshooting method we tried the the pen did not extrude at all. Believe me we tried them all. Then we gave up because it was Christmas day and had better things to do than troubleshoot a faulty Christmas present. The manufacturer included a warning flier inside the instruction manual that reads, "STOP! Before you return this product blah, blah, blah..." Should have been a red flag.
customer_reviews.author: Livingstons

customer_reviews.title: Defective on arrival, no response from the seller
customer_reviews.text: I was so looking forward to creating some cute little package decorations for the Christmas gifts I'm giving this year. I have plenty of experience with 3D printers but wanted to do something a little more hand-made. Unfortunately, this pen only extruded on the highest speed, and would go into sleep mode within a couple seconds of stopping the extrusion. I went through all the troubleshooting steps, including disassembling the unit (per instructions), tried several different filaments (ABS and PLA), all to no avail. I tried contacting MYNT but so far have not received a response. I'm returning it for a refund and have purchased a different unit from a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Constant Shadow

customer_reviews.title: Don't last!!! Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item on April 10 for my son birthday. It already stopped working (the filament will not feed forward). My husband followed exact trouble shooting tips to be sure no obstruction inside tubbing/nozzle part. My son's took care of the pen with every use. It's only less than 2 months old (only been in used several times). I am mad it stopped working already 😡 don't buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: DHR

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the first faulty pen I ordered, only to find the replacement broke just as immediately. Neither unit managed to get any filament through to the nozzle before breaking. Attempting to extrude after this would reset the display and therefore the whole pen almost instantly. Letting it is for a minute or two increased the amount of time the pen would successfully build up the nozzle temperature before resetting without reason. DO NOT buy this pen unless you want a nice looking prop 3D pen that doesn't 3D print anything
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Thomason

customer_reviews.title: No feed no speed no temp maintain
customer_reviews.text: Guess i should have read all of the reviews... Same problem as another customer. Speed control is a joke and never works at anything less than max feed. Having to keep racing the temp to get anything done is a pain. The feed button sometimes works, sometimes auto feeds, just gotta keep pressing the button till something changes, usually resulting in a fat glob because i didnt think it'd actually work... With any luck i can still use it for plastic welding and repair.
customer_reviews.author: David Mayson

customer_reviews.title: Double Jeopardy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this pen for my Grandson for his birthday. We followed the instructions exactly and could never get the motor that pulls the line through to work. Followed website guidance which led me to the advice to return the defective device. Well, OK, maybe we just got a dude. Ordered a replacement and I'll be, the motor on that one would only run in reverse. Opened the pen up, examined the engineering and determined that this pen was designed by Dopey of the 7 Dwarfs.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Hinson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Hold Temperature. Unusable.
customer_reviews.text: I got this with the plan of welding 3d prints together, but tested it on its own first. It can't hold a temperature even for PLA. While extruding it stops every second or two to warm up again, making it unusable. Figuring it might just be defective, I ordered a replacement which was very obviously used - seal broken and there was used filament in the box. So that one is going back as well, along with this review to warn you not to waste your time with these.
customer_reviews.author: Kato

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good
customer_reviews.text: The temperature is advertised as maxing out at 240. The manual and device say 230. If you needed that higher temp, it could be a problem. I usually print petg at 245, and was using this to connect larger pieces together. It extruded just fine at 230, it does mention in the manual to use a lower temp than you normally would. Also, the extruded gear really digs into the filament, but it didn't seem to be a problem either. Additionally, it includes ABS which has some bad VOCs when melted. So wear a respirator if using ABS maybe?
customer_reviews.author: Douglas ST. CLAIR

customer_reviews.title: short lifespan for the $$
customer_reviews.text: When working this pen was fun to use. Without many total hours of use, the feed mechanism stopped. I looked for any jammed parts and there were none visible. Had to manually remove filament which was left in tube as reverse feed would not work. Worked to understand if the nozzle was good or perhaps causing the problem as it may all be one circuit. It heats up fine, the display works fine, the feed mechanism does nothing.
customer_reviews.author: JAA

customer_reviews.title: Best of all the 3D pens I've used
customer_reviews.text: 3D pens are great for small repairs and fun art projects and there are quite a few on the market from which to choose. I've used all the major brands however this one stands out for its ease of use and consistent performance. Many pens offer variable temperature and speed control with buttons but they don't respond well to adjusting these settings as you draw. The MYNT3D has a slider to control the speed which is much better. The pen doesn't look as groovy as some of its contoured competitors but its what's under the hood that counts.
customer_reviews.author: Astute Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working just after 90 Day return window
customer_reviews.text: This pen worked pretty good for adding to 3D printed items i make. The temperature display was always Jumping all over from 30 to 170 to 215. But it worked once it got to 215. I have been using it for 3 months like that and never any problems. I bought the most expensive "Professional" model hoping it would last and work well. Now it gets to temperature and squeezes out a 1/4" of material and then the display reads 30 degrees /215 degrees so it stops extruding. It does it every time now. Heats up then stops. So its dead after 95days
customer_reviews.author: Kirk D

customer_reviews.title: Not good for shed building
customer_reviews.text: I tried to build a shed for myself this takes way too long to do that
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using any kind of 3d pen. It is very easy to use. I've probably pushed a good 100 feet of filament though this bad boy and no issues still on the original tip. I am using it to help create interior's for my RC Crawlers. Its not perfect yet (because of my skill level) but for my first time doing this I can see how this 3d pen will come in handy. Just ordered some tools to help with smoothing and I will probably never put the pen down...lol if you can picture it in your head you can make it with this pen pretty much
customer_reviews.author: Atraxx12

customer_reviews.title: Finally figured out what is wrong with these pens...
customer_reviews.text: Initially could not figure what was wrong with this pen as it would only work randomly and sometime not at all. It is the usb adapter that came with it. After plugging it in to the usb on my computer it started to work. Weird. I am sending this one back but ordered another just like it and will see if it does the same thing. Quality control is lacking on this pen and customer support is non existent... UPDATE: Second one had the same issue. Customer support is still to respond. Not good business in my book...
customer_reviews.author: WRC

customer_reviews.title: Works Wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: The pen has a smooth print, but if the temperature is too high, the plastic will have bubbles. After playing with this pen for about 30 minutes, I had the basics down and it was a lot of fun. The plastic doesn't stick to anything well, so it makes it hard to draw, but I read in the instructions that if you use a glue stick and put a thin layer over whatever it is that you're trying to draw on, it'll stick a lot better and it did! This was a replacement pen for my daughter after her last one broke after just a few uses and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: My go to pen
customer_reviews.text: I love this pen, I got a huge box of fillament after doing some research on what I wanted out of the pen and I even took it to work with me and showed my students how to use it. They fell in love with the 3d pen and some of them made some really cool works of art.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.C.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm. I use it to repair 3D Prints, along side a 3D print hot tool.
customer_reviews.text: Takes 1.75mm Filament and extrudes it nicely at the temperature you specify. Motor has a good pull on it, so it can actually pull the filament straight off of a spool. Ceramic tip is easy to clean, although nothing has stuck to it so far. Like others have said, it needs a much longer power cord (-1 Star) but that's something I can fix.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: Cool you
customer_reviews.text: I just received mine today and smashed through the provided filament. I recommend purchasing extras with the pen. The quality of the pen is nice and feels good in the hand, the only issue I have with it is that the temperature setting resets with the speed control set to slow, this is a known issue for models made in 2019 according to mynt3d, This makes it hard to make anything. You should be able to get a replacement power brick through them to fix this issue by contacting them directly. I’ll update my rating when my new brick comes in and if it fixes the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Luis E Rordiguez

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pen as a Christmas gift. The recipient opened it xmas morning and it did not work. We followed the trouble shooting instructions and we were left with the suggestion of buying a replacement tip. The tip appeared to be clogged with white filament (a color that didn't come with the pen) the tip looked dirty as if the pen had been used before and perhaps returned. I would hope the company wouldn't sell a product that had been returned. I am disappointed we were very excited to try this pen. Won't buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Martinson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold temperature
customer_reviews.text: The first one didn’t work at all. Second one will not hold temperature. You can’t use it for more than 10 seconds at a time before the heat drops and it won’t feed. The screw hole on the nozzle broke causing the nozzle to shoot out from the pen. I’m working with the manufacturer on a solution. I would avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Oldfield

customer_reviews.title: Works after replacing defective AC adapter
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, I had the same problem like others recently where the pen would only work for a short amount of time before "rebooting" itself. I tried with my phone's AC adapter and verified that the pen was actually okay; just the supplied AC adapter was defective. I emailed MYNT3D's support about this and they promptly sent me a replacement AC adapter free of charge that functions properly. As for the pen, it works as expected. I mostly just use it for repairing or welding my 3D prints.
customer_reviews.author: jdp

customer_reviews.title: HOT GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: Just boot loops. Starts up, warms up, reboots. That's all they do. BOTH of them did the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: compnerd

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control. Unusable.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted this to work because it had the variable temp and speed, but received the unit and it would start to extrude and then stop. Replacement unit did the same. Cust svc never returned calls. Would not recommend buying this unit as it wasted my time and money. They should not be allowed to continue to sell a defective product. Hope this helps you to make a decision.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Had used it for less than 30 minutes when it jammed. The service door was extremely difficult to open with very minimal instructions on how to do it. The instructions says” start by prying the door open with a thin, flat tool”. Tried using the very flimsy plastic screw driver it came with, after looking up a YouTube video, and it just bent. Resorted to using a very tiny screw driver which slipped as the door finally gave way, and in the process it damaged the feeder button and rendered the pen useless. It may have been my fault that the button got damaged, but it should not have been that difficult to open the service door.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Thomas

customer_reviews.title: This pen sucks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pen for my son and let me just say it’s a terrible product. The pen clogged after every use and it is a pain to unclog. You have to open a panel and they give you a tiny flimsy tool to open. After a few times this tool becomes bendy and useless. Eventually the temperature part stopped working after a couple days and I sent for a replacement. I had the same issues with the new pen with the clogging. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Sikes

customer_reviews.title: Better than 3Doodler!
customer_reviews.text: I got a 3Doodler for my budding artist, but it was to finnicky and the fact it only uses stick filament meant you were constantly loading new filament and dealing with jams from the short left-overs. The Mynt 3D, on the other hand can use standard spool filament, so it doesn’t jam and you can sculpt longer without having to deal with annoying sticks. The OLED display and temperature controls also make it easier to fine tune for the filament you are using. The 3Doodler only has “hi” and “lo” settings... I liked it so much that I bought a second for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Bokistcltr

customer_reviews.title: No quality control. Returned 2 units
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 units and returned both for the same reason. There is something faulty with either their software or hardware. The device is supposed to have a variable speed setting, but when at any speed other than the maximum, the device would hard reset itself as soon as it reached the set temperature. At the fastest speed setting the device would deposit filament, but the device would still reset as soon as you let go of the button to deposit material. I would suggest looking elsewhere for a 3D pen, or hope to get a working one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the older kids
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 12 year old granddaughter last Christmas. She loved it...and made me a lovely flower in a flower pot.
customer_reviews.author: L. McManus

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 1 minute of use
customer_reviews.text: It was fun for a minute, but doesn't take long for it to get jammed. Tried using the provided tools to clean it out but to take it apart requires more force than the plastic can handle. Received it as a gift, and now I feel bad for my girlfriend who purchased it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: The description states that this goes up to 240°C, however the unit I received maxed out at 230°C. The unit I received was also unable to extrude the filament. After removing the access panel, it appeared that the extruder did not have enough power to pull the filament through, so it never even got up to the hot end.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Quality Pen
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son to replace the last one I bought that was clunky and slow. This pen is great. It has a sleek design closer to an actual pen, it has a sturdy construction and a good weight. The variable speed controller is located where you can adjust while using it and not have to move your hands. I am really happy with this pen, I have already recommended it to a friend at work.
customer_reviews.author: tnelson301

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this the first pen worked about an hour, so Amazon was awesome and replaced it. The second one never worked at all. I had better luck with the cheap one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Turns off randomly
customer_reviews.text: It randomly turns off. I did ask my daughter if she wanted me to send it back. Since it was a gift she said she would just deal with it turning off several times during use. I should of listened to the other reviews that people had the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: A great tool for patching up minor glitches in machine generated 3D prints!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to be able to fix up minor defects in some of the 3D prints that come off my platform 3D printer, and it works great for that purpose. The temperature adjustment and display is an essential feature for doing this especially since different filaments can have significantly different melting temperatures. It heats up and cools down very quickly and is super easy to use too so is highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: David p.

customer_reviews.title: best pen i found for welding 3d prints
customer_reviews.text: The price is a little high, but you pay a premium for quality. I use mine to weld 3D printed parts together. My tiny 3D printer cant print respirator masks without it! There is no adhesive that works as well as a weld of the same material. Half the time, I neglect to load the pen, and instead re-mold support structures from the prints themselves. Thanks to quick heatup times and adjustable temp control, I doubt there is a better 3D pen for this task.
customer_reviews.author: ZazzMan

customer_reviews.title: Weak/defective power adapters, but super fun!
customer_reviews.text: After trying every permutation of cable, adapter, pen, plastic... I narrowed down the issue to 2 faulty power adapters. Pen would suddenly "reboot" and would have to wait for the temp to go up again. When plugging the pen into a 3rd party USB charging hub, it performed perfectly for hours so I'm 100% positive it was a faulty power adapter. Aside from the power issues, pen is great! Super fun, heats up fast. It would have been nice to have some sort of stand/mount. Brings color and fun to my 3d printer projects! My 6 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Harvs

customer_reviews.title: Completely unusable
customer_reviews.text: It constantly stays one degree below the desired temperature, and it only extrudes when it is exactly on it, and when it finally does extrude it drops 10 degrees for seemingly no reason. When it does work it only happens when you use the max speed settings, so its completely unusable for any amount of decent details. I purchased replacement tips from their website to see if that helped but it didn't change anything.
customer_reviews.author: Timmy Drake

customer_reviews.title: Found it to be extremely difficult to use. I do not recommend this pen.
customer_reviews.text: For some reason two of them were sent and it’s a good thing because when my granddaughter opened the one it didn’t work so I had to open the second one. Found it to be extremely difficult to use. I do not recommend this pen.
customer_reviews.author: FRAIDNOT67

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: This was product was crap. My daughters 1st 3D pen NOT MADE by this company lasted over a year. We decided to get her a new one for a gift. Product arrived in the mail we opened up the package and noticed it’s plastic seal was broke yet the outside of box seal was not. As she put in the filament it wasn’t coming out. We waited as instructed and there it was a completely different color came out. Then the filament we used started to come out then completely jammed. BEWARE THIS COMPANY SENT US A USED PRODUCT PRICED AS A NEW ONE. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Cresho

customer_reviews.title: Great when it's working
customer_reviews.text: My pen will go into sleep mode during drawing and the hot end temp drop. I have to manually activate it heat it up again to make it work. Very annoying. See video.
customer_reviews.author: qifei

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY Doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: This company is knowingly selling these when they know they DO NOT work, got mine and it kept going into standby mode and wouldn’t work. When you go to their website it says in red, you need a new power adapter !!!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Hewett

customer_reviews.title: Won't hold set temperature & stops drawing as soon as it isn't one degree off.
customer_reviews.text: Stops drawing as soon as the temperature fluctuates from the set temperature. I'll start drawing and 3 seconds later it stops. I've even gone outside in the blazing FL heat and the pin still goes from 180 to 160 in less than a min. If they'd had made it so it would let me draw even if it dropped in temperature I could make it work, but I can't draw more than 5 inches before it stops.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Tibbe

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: First you WILL have a power supply issue. The one provided will not power the unit in any speed but the highest and will not keep it hot. Next it WILL jam up the tip. At that point it you’ll clear the tip but the feed tube will warp due to the heat and then it will not feed. The price point was awesome but poorly conceived build quality. I got maybe four hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Brown

customer_reviews.title: Clogged with first use and couldn't be unclogged.
customer_reviews.text: It sits in our closet unused because it clogged up immediately upon the first use with the included resin after about two minutes and we did read the instructions and watched videos about how to supposedly prevent that.
customer_reviews.author: Osiris

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D Pen
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent pen. Easy to set up and easy to use. Like any 3D printing pen there is a learning curve to using one. This one minimizes that. The speed control is easy to use and it prints very well. My 3D art skill sucks still. But it works great for the reason I bought it. I mostly am using this to join other 3D prints. Ones I have designed to be “glued” with this. And it works amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Czichos

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this pen. It’s a really nice pen I just got mine and started using it right out of the box. I don’t have any experience using a 3D pen and I was very comfortable using it the very first time. The variable speed button is great I can speed out the flow or slow it down for more precise details. Great product lots of fun thinking of getting a second one. I wanted to add to this review. I had the pen for over a week now and I love it. No jams so far. I just purchased flexible filament and it worked like a charm. I love this thing
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this item isn’t eligible for return. It jams, like a lot. So when you what to continually open the back panel and clean out the jam, it’s beyond frustrating for a kid who just wants to create. We’ve tried to create with this on three separate occasions. Always the same issue. Jams and jams. On the third use, it broke. Just past the one month return window. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold temperature
customer_reviews.text: This was a second pen after my daughter received one for Christmas. Hers was very cool and worked great and bought this pen for myself to make things with her. Right out of the package, the pen would not maintain the proper temperature and kept stopping after mere seconds. The motor struggled as well after a few seconds of operation. The manufactures trouble shooting fix for this is to replace the tip. Sorry, not right out of the box. This may have been a fluke but there are other choices on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory R Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my granddaughter. Based on the description, it seemed perfect for her artistic creative tendencies. However, we were very disappointed. The item does not work correctly. The buttons that activate the feeding motor will not operate as described. They require multiple pushes, and even then, they may not work. When the item does work, it will not perform as pictured. Also the customer service is nonexistent. I have send multiple emails and left many voice messages, and I have not received any response.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Loy

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: Have not used the ABS at all, only the PLA. This is the second pen I got which the first one lasted... maybe 5 hours tops. Maybe. So I spent a little bit more for this guy and I have have quite a few more decent amount of hours and I am impressed! It still works, it heats up pretty quickly, and most amazingly it still hasnt clogged up yet. Which, from what I read, they will inevitably do at some point. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Smola

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one first
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 3D pen for my son for Christmas. He loved it but we ran into trouble buying the right filament and it was poor quality. I cheaped out, I admit it. So, a few months later I got him this one. He LOVES it. It's easy to use, has much better flow, uses a more available filament. He is 13 and creative and this has been a great activity for him in quarantine.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Miller

customer_reviews.title: Surpringly excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several 3d pens previously and I must say I am most impressed with this pen. I was worried about the build quality being low but after using it over 5 hours daily I am no longer worried. Smooth flow, uses several different filaments, comfortable to hold, and rapid heating with saftey features. I would definitely reccommend this pen for intermediate to advanced 3d pen users.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany J.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.text: This product was aweful. The instant it hit temp it died. We replaced the 1st one and got another and had the exact same issue. After returning it's been 14 days since the product was received and we still have not received our refund.
customer_reviews.author: krystal bridwell

customer_reviews.title: Keeps turning off
customer_reviews.text: For being an expensive 3d pen, I have been more impressed by freind's cheap models. TO use the pen you obviously must let it heat up. Within the time it took it me to wait, I would come back and the pen has turned off. So, I'd have to turn it back on and wait again... the streaming of the plastic is very hard to control and I haven't been interested enough to use it since I got it...
customer_reviews.author: veronika karn

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Well my out of box experience sucked! And that's putting it nicely. After battling it to load my pla some other color of filament came out, guessing it's used and I'm the sucker that got the return. Only stays on for 10 seconds and shuts off and doesn't hold a temperature. Think I'm returning it. I just wanted to repair some prints
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It sucks
customer_reviews.text: You cant make anything good with it, if I could make 0/5 that's what I would do.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kh.

customer_reviews.title: Flow chart standard for problems.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work from the start even after going through the flow chart of issues.
customer_reviews.author: Julianna Monnot

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my sun thought it might be fun to play with some new cool tech. However I found this pen is not very safe for kids to play. It gets extremely hot during the process that could potentially hurt your kids.
customer_reviews.author: Pandora

customer_reviews.title: Great pen and most excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Initially I purchased this pen a couple of years ago as a gift. After hearing how much my gift was appreciated I decided to purchase another pen for myself. I’m so glad I did. It’s my first 3D pen and I have really enjoyed creating multiple “unique” works of art. I did have a problem with one of the buttons on the pen after a few weeks. I was surprised and thankful for the prompt responsiveness I received from the company’s support team. I explained my issue, provided purchase information, and the support team promptly agreed to send a replacement pen to me. Great service for a nifty device.
customer_reviews.author: Five In Texas

customer_reviews.title: They sell extra nozzels
customer_reviews.text: The good, the bad, and the ugly. The feed mechanisms on this pen is really good. Temp control is right on. But as a novice using PET I blocked the opening too hard and caused a disaterous ugly jam at the nozzle that could not be cleared. The good news is that the manufacture sells replacement nozzle for $5 plus $6 shipping. I bought 2.
customer_reviews.author: HuskyGuy

customer_reviews.title: Does its job well
customer_reviews.text: 3D-printing pens are a squiggly, doodle-world of chaos, but a lot of fun. I use this to patch areas on my 3D-printed models and it is fantastic for that purpose. There have been a few clogging issues here and there, but I suspect that's widespread across brands. My expensive 3D printer clogs sometimes, nature of the beast.
customer_reviews.author: OldCornerGlassworks

customer_reviews.title: Better than the previous one
customer_reviews.text: I received a better looking item and beautifully packaged one as a gift. Used it twice, never easily...it didn't work well the third time, took it apart, and as usual with electronic stuff, threw it away. Bought this one and have used it several times and it was a pleasure. Hope to use it many more times successfully.
customer_reviews.author: I. S. Pollak

customer_reviews.title: Check a power adapter
customer_reviews.text: The pen works as expected. At the same time I have to say that it took me a while to realize that the power adapter is faulty. I suspect that most of the recent packages may contain faulty adapter. Symptoms: withdraw button does not work; feeding stops every 5-10 sec; temperature constantly goes up and down. At the end I took a 2 Amps smartphone adapter and it fixed the issue. As I understand the supplier could send you a new power adapter if needed. Hope the description helps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Always being jammed
customer_reviews.text: The very first day I got it I made a quick try, and it jammed, I thought maybe I didn't operate correctly. So on Sunday I read the manual and watched the video, then I tried and tried and tried, it jammed every single time, it just can't work continuous more than 3 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Z.

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay up to temp
customer_reviews.text: Once heated it up, after pushing about 4 inches of filament through the unit gets too cold and stops, have to wait for it to reheat again. Just won't stay up to temp. I bought this because of it having so many good reviews, was really disappointed, Looking for a different option now. Returning this unit, I figure I probably just got a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: slove

customer_reviews.title: Fake
customer_reviews.text: The product we received was a fake. First of all the charging cable was missing from the box. We bought another cable and tried but it wouldn’t turn on so we checked the inside and compared to an original one from YouTube. Many parts from inside were missing. Waste of money. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Y.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: This pen works pretty good, sometimes the filament needs to be assisted through. I guess it either gets hung up or filament diameter is uneven so it has a hard time grabbing the parts that are on the thin side. Temp control works pretty good. Pen body has a good feel and so far does what I need it to do. I'd recommend this to others
customer_reviews.author: Greg Whitmire

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This thing loses temp immediately. Won't extruded without constantly troubleshooting. That's what I got out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Ford

customer_reviews.title: Tends to Loose Heat Very Quickly
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent quality printing pen. It is easy to use, and works. But what I don't like about it is that it tends to loose it's heat setting withing a 5 seconds after not using it., then it takes another 5 seconds to warm up again. I don't know, but I might just have a defective pen, and the others might not have the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: A let down.
customer_reviews.text: After lite use, the stopped working. I’ve tried contacting the manufacturer several times and haven’t heard back. I explained that this was intended for my child’s art project, but still no response. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: joshua f.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: As long as it doesn't break down in the future, I love this pen so far. I know I'm being negative by worrying about a possible future breakdown, but the pen almost seems too good to be true when you consider how reasonable the price is.
customer_reviews.author: tambeb

customer_reviews.title: DISLIKE Save yourself the aggravation
customer_reviews.text: impossible to use.. i purchased this for my teen son who was very excited. it was difficult to impossible to use
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Redman

customer_reviews.title: nothing is ever as easy as the pics make it look - but this is a GREAT tool for learning 3D drawing
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter is 12, and i got this for her for christmas. she's never done anythign 3D before, and has figured this out quickly and is making small items with it. the pen is reliable and works well. never as easy as you hope something will be, but she's stuck with it - which is a great sign!
customer_reviews.author: Annmarie Cross

customer_reviews.title: Slower than a sloth!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t seem to work well at all unless you draw like a sloth and even then material hardens before the thing heats back up. This was a gift for my child but was disappointing. I even bought extra materials and colors.
customer_reviews.author: Keeless

customer_reviews.title: Super Impressed! No Issues, Easy to Use, Lots of Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic 3D pen! Hasn't clogged once (tip is replaceable if it does clog). LCD display works great; speed & temp are easily adjustable & smooth to use. Had no problem changing colors or switching from ABS to PLA. All controls can be done with one hand while pen is in use. Bit of a learning curve, but you'll quickly get the hang of it. Our 9 & 14 yo boys loved it; now they want one too! Ordered off-brand filament refills & they were all compatible. Super impressed with the quality, especially for the price! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MissyKttnPants

customer_reviews.title: Provided charger is too weak.
customer_reviews.text: The pen itself is great but provided charger is too weak to keep the temperature of the pen. So I thought it was defective item at first but new pen came after I returned old one had same problem. I used other charger instead of provided charger and it was just fine and worked great. it is just stupid that provided charger is not working properly.
customer_reviews.author: Draft Latte

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son for a gift, he LOVES IT! He has had so much fun creating all sorts of things, from simple items to trees and houses! I highly recommend this product and I also recommend following the directions on the care of the pen closely, so you don't cause a jam.
customer_reviews.author: mrs longshot

customer_reviews.title: Creative potential is limitless.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to load, and operate. It can go though alot of the filament quickly. It arrives with 3 little lengths of filament which you will use up almost immediatly. Order the big spools of the colors you like when you order this thing cause you will wsnt to create. Ive been making sculptures, hard masks. This pen heats quickly and you can adjust speed to work at what speed you prefer.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick P.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of power supply/USB adapter!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item and immediately had issues with the pen holding the correct temperature. Pen appeared to "reset" itself after just a few millimeters of filament had been passed though - hinted by a flicker of the LED screen and the welcome message. Amazon Q&A lead me to changing the USB power adapter to my Samsung Fast Charging one and the problem went away. Other than that the pen is satisfactory and I look forward to using it quite a bit!
customer_reviews.author: David brasher

customer_reviews.title: Bad power supply
customer_reviews.text: Pen works well unfortunately Power supply block that was provided does t provide enough power to power the pen. Every time the feed button is pressed the starts to feed filaments screen turns on and off and temperature drops and the process starts all overagl again. Plugged into my computer there are no issues and pen works well. Powerblock is bad. I will update my review when I receive a replacement power supply block.
customer_reviews.author: Jacques

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Maybe
customer_reviews.text: Much easier to use than other brands I have tried. Great product! Update... had to order a second one, first one broke after one month of heavy use... kinda disappointed, we'll see how long the second one lasts.
customer_reviews.author: rowdiegurl

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: It seems like it is a great product when you read the reviews. We tried two different Units and both didn’t work. The plastic did not self feed and therefore it didn’t work. Great concept. I hope other brands can come out with something similar.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Didn't buy for craft but for repairs
customer_reviews.text: Did not buy to make but to repair things. So far so good. Repaired a pair of glasses and the clip on the dishwasher utensil rack. Would have used the correct color but the kit only comes with blue, red and yellow. Not the best look but some smoothing and sanding required but it works and appears to be sturdy repair job.
customer_reviews.author: LaTrenda Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Defective x 2
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my kids for Christmas. It was defective so I returned it. The new one they sent me is having the same problem. It resets whenever you push the feed button, unless it is on the full speed setting. This is too fast for some projects and especially for kids. I noticed other people are having this same problem. Such a disappointment for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well at all
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed in this product. I sent one back and got a new one and both did not work well. the speed could not be adjusted at all and i spent more time trying to fix it than get to use it. I sent the second one back for a refund and will not use this company again
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1mo
customer_reviews.text: ETA: Company was pretty responsive. Apparently there was a faulty charger on some of the pens and will be sending a new charger. Will update once it arrives. The pen stopped working after about 1 month. Just after the return window closed. Led display flashed and then went dark. Very disappointed at the new version. The old version worked much better.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Momma Doxies

customer_reviews.title: Bad metals
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of them and broke so quick my son told he only use two or three time it broke
customer_reviews.author: Feng jing yang

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for teen girls.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great gift for teen girls. The only down side it that it doesn’t make straight lines very well, and you have to build up your work to make it sturdy. It easily breaks, so you need to be very careful. Other than that, it’s fun to use, and be creative with.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer hanson

customer_reviews.title: The worst 3D pen on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely in my life have had to write a bad review. I went through two pens in 3 week period. Finally got my refund after waiting a month. The company I bought from on here are not to blame, it’s the product. The first ones heat exchanger splintered, and melted together. The seconds motor broke down. I will never trust anything from this company.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Motor failed almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: I managed to get maybe two feet of drawing done before the motor failed. Definitely not what I expected from a pen at this price point. Maybe I was the unlucky guy that got a bad one. Maybe this is low quality with a mid-range price. Kids are disappointed. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My husband used it one time and went to use a second time and it won’t work now. He called the company and they have not called him back
customer_reviews.author: Jill Wheelock

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work, very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when I received this for my tenth birthday! When I got around to using it it didn’t work at all I put in the filament, plugged it in and nothing came out! Also the instructions are very difficult to follow so confusing! We watched the video which was also no help. Very disappointed. If I could give it zero stars I would. - entire review by a ten year old girl
customer_reviews.author: Claudia  Helmke

customer_reviews.title: Cool concept, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend. The unit we received had to constantly heat up, which means it would stop shooting the filament out. It would only work in spurts. The feed was spotty and seemed to jam up. Child grew very frustrated with trying to use it.
customer_reviews.author: patrick hardy

customer_reviews.title: Expensive gift if the person isn't going to use it much.
customer_reviews.text: Daughter likes it. But she only used it a few times. I don't know if it's the best gift. Unless your child has really been asking for a lot and you think they'll use it. Because it is kind of expensive plus you have to buy the refill material.
customer_reviews.author: ChainsawNuts

customer_reviews.title: Returned twice
customer_reviews.text: The first oen I bought only works intermittently on the fastest setting and otherwise did not work at all. The replacement I got did not come with a power cord so there is no way to know that it works properly. Also I have tried several 3d pens and this company does not provide as many accessories in the box as other brands. Not at all actually just the pen, powercord and 3 colors abs but not much of it. The title says professional 3d pen so I would expect a little more out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Rida's audible

customer_reviews.title: Versatile 3d Pen
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily to use with my regular 3d printer. It was one of the few I could find that would accommodate the temperatures needed for PETG, which I print with a lot. It lists ABS and PLA as the materials it handles, but with the range and precise temperature adjustments, it seems to handle anything within its temperature range. I've tried a little 3d drawing with it and it seems up to the task, but I primarily use it for plastic welding on other 3d print projects. I haven't used it enough for a thorough review yet, but so far it seems quite good.
customer_reviews.author: Richard LB

customer_reviews.title: Problem at first.
customer_reviews.text: Gifted this item during the holidays and found the power adapter was defective. Contacted the manufacture and they quickly sent a replacement resolving the issue. I was happy I did not have send the item back for a return and works flawlessly now.
customer_reviews.author: Gil.S

customer_reviews.title: Decent pen if it works...
customer_reviews.text: First order was returned because the internal box was completley smashed and the pen didn't work. Second order was returned because it wouldn't extrude any pla no matter what temp. Finally got one from another shop that worked, but was disheartening that two of three didn't work!
customer_reviews.author: str8moben

customer_reviews.title: functional design, some caveats
customer_reviews.text: If your mynt3d pen stops advancing the filament every few seconds, or can't maintain the correct temperature, try using a different AC to USB adapter which outputs 2 - 2.1 amps. I was quite frustrated with this pen until another user pointed out that cheap chargers often output fewer amps than labeled. Once I switched to a different charger (at 2.1 amps) the issue was resolved and the pen handled continuous extrusion quite well. It's a shame that the experience was almost compromised by a shoddy charger, but I don't think that it necessarily reflects the construction of the pen itself.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Brown

product_meta.title: MYNT3D Professional Printing 3D Pen with OLED Display
product_meta.description: Doodle, sketch and paint in 3D with this quality pen. See images above. It features variable extrusion speed control and large OLED display to help monitor heat. The temperature can be adjusted from 130 to 240 C in 1 degree increments, to help fine-tune the thickness & flow-rate of extruded material. This drawing kit comes with a lightweight, ergonomic stylus, 3 colors of ABS plastic and a 100-240V AC 50/60Hz adapter. It has a Power Output of 10 Watts with an Input power of 5 Volts/DC 2A, so it can be used safely outdoors as well. FCC, CE and RoHS-certified. Turn your ordinary drawings into 3D works of art. Order yours today!
feature_bullets: Watch imagination come to life with the Professional 3D Pen
Adjustable feed lets you regulate speed & flow for optimal control of material while you're drawing
Temperature is adjustable in 1 degree increments from 130 to 240 C, for optimal fine-tuning
Large, OLED display lets you monitor temperature of material to help you achieve a wide variety of effects
Kit includes 3 colors of ABS plastic filament A/C adapter and slim, ergonomic touch pen with 1 year limited warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
